ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to develop and narrow down a topic, how to synthesize information, how to combine areas of interest in compelling ways, how to organize a lengthy paper
I have developed my senior thesis so much with my advisor this semester!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: We need a colloquium for this course. Desperately. Fortunately, I had research experience and had conducted ethnographic research over the summer before senior year, but many of my senior colleagues had not and REALLY needed some extra guidance. Honestly, I would have appreciated extra guidance even though I didn't necessarily need it. I think that our work would be all the richer with talking it over in a colloquium. Diversity of thought= better work. I spent many hours (20+) supporting other students through their theses instead of spending that time on my own thesis, and while I am always happy to support others, I do not believe that should be my labor. I know that a lot of students have been requesting this for a while, so I implore you to listen to students and to work with them in order to make your department better.
I think seniors would benefit from a more formal colloquium arrangement or other structured essay writing opportunities

I think the senior essay is what you make it. For me, it was a really rewarding experience. Finding a professor who is knowledgeable about your topic or area of interest but also who is invested in your personal, professional, and intellectual growth is key.
The class gave me the freedom to work independently and to receive feedback from my advisor.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Spending the time and energy to make my thesis a work that I was proud of was SO very worth it. I would highly recommend picking a topic you enjoy and producing great work on it.

I think the senior essay is what you make it. For me, it was a really rewarding experience. Finding a professor who is knowledgeable about your topic or area of interest but also who is invested in your personal, professional, and intellectual growth is key. Other than that, stay on top of any interim deadlines and submit a detailed outline before mid-term.
This is required for anthropology majors.
